Description: Copper alloy arrow-head with short triangular point, trefoil section and short socket. Also known as trilobate, or 'Scythian type'. A socketted arrowhead with a triangular cross-section and three barbs. Highly corroded; end of one barb broken.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Redpath Museum, Montreal. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

These socketed trilobate arrow-head types are common in the Middle East from the 7th century BC and subsequently in Greece and Egypt. For a discussion of provenance see Pelleg et al. 1983. See AES 1885,1101.99 from Naukratis. This example has good parallels for the mid 5th to 4th centuries BC (Baitinger 2001, fig. 225, Dreiflügelige Tüllenpfeilspitzen type IIB1). James dates this type (James 2004, figs 668-670) between Achaemenid and early Hellenistic periods. These short socket types come in before the 5th century BC, with parallels from Tell Dafana and the nearby site of T21 that Oren identifies as ‘Migdol’ (Snodgrass 1964, 153 shaft-less three edged socketed Form 3B3; Erdmann 1973, 35 Form CI3, dated to 7th to 4th centuries BC and into the Hellenistic period; Oren 1984, 25, fig. 26.5 dated to late 7th to 6th centuries BC). Baitinger, H. 2001, Die Angriffswaffen aus Olympia, Berlin & New York. Erdmann, E. 1973. ‘Die sogenannten Marathonpfeilspitzen in Karlsruhe’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 88, 30-58. British Museum parallels from Egypt BM/BIG 42174. James, S. 2004, The Arms and Armour, and other Military Equipment. Excavations at Dura-Europos 1928-1937, London. Forsdyke E. J. 1919/20, ‘Some arrow-heads from the battlefield of Marathon’, Proceedings of the Society of Antiquaries of London 2.32, 146-157. Oren, E. D. 1984, ‘Migdol: A New Fortress on the Edge of the Eastern Nile Delta’, Bulletin of the American Schools of Oriental Research 256, 7-44. Pelleg, J., Baram, J. and Oren, E. D. 1983, ‘Analysis of bronze arrowheads of the Saite period from the Nile Delta region’, Metallography 16.1, 81-98. Snodgrass, A. M. 1964, Early Greek armour and weapons from the end of the Bronze Age to 600 BC, Edinburgh. Snodgrass, A. M. 1967, Arms and armour of the Greeks, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (SB.58) (Phase 2)
